alert.note: Alert for Butler; Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 7:08PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Butler and northwestern Crenshaw Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 708 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Highland Home, or 10 miles northwest of Luverne, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Butler and northwestern Crenshaw Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
